subject: Ethics
title: IVF and Embryo Selection
description: A 60-second lesson on IVF and Embryo Selection.

hook.text: Louise Brown was born in 1978â€”the world's first 'test tube baby.' Headlines called it playing God.

buildup.text: IVF creates multiple embryos outside the body. Doctors select the healthiest ones to implant.

discovery.text: Preimplantation genetic testing can screen embryos for serious diseases before pregnancy begins.

twist.text: But 'healthy' is a sliding scale. Screen out Down syndrome? Deafness? Short stature? Where's the line?

climax.text: Every selection reflects a judgment about which lives are worth starting. That's a heavy choice.

punchline.text: Choosing the 'best' embryo means deciding what counts as best.

quiz.question: What ethical concern does preimplantation genetic testing raise?
options: IVF is too expensive for most families
Test tube babies have lower intelligence
Screening embryos requires judgments about which traits are acceptable
